title: Osama Bin Laden advised jihadists to MASTURBATE as they were ‘in a state of extreme need'
text:
Osama Bin Laden advised jihadists to MASTURBATE as they were ‘in a state of extreme need' Osama Bin Laden advised jihadists to MASTURBATE as they were ‘in a state of extreme need' OSAMA bin Laden told Al-Qaeda leaders to allow jihadists to masturbate because they were “in a state of extreme need”, according to newly released documents. PUBLISHED: 00:04, Tue, Feb 7, 2017 | UPDATED: 00:09, Tue, Feb 7, 2017 GETTY Osama bin Laden appeared to have no problem allowing jihadists to pleasure themselves 
In a top-secret memo, the former Al-Qaeda kingpin told one of his top aides in North Africa to let the terrorists pleasure themselves in certain circumstances because they had to spend long periods of time away from their wives. 
The revelation comes after the Office of the Director of National Intelligence (DNI) released 50 documents snatched by the US in 2011. Related articles As we see it, we have no objection to clarifying to the brothers that they may, in such conditions, masturbate, since this is an extreme case Osama bin Laden 
In the letter, bin Laden wrote: “Another very special and top secret matter - it pertains to the problem of the brothers who are with you in their unfortunate celibacy and lack of availability of wives for them in the conditions that have been imposed on them. 
“We pray to God to release them. 
“God is not ashamed of the truth. Death of Osama Bin Laden: In Pictures Mon, May 2, 2011 1 of 21 Pakistanis burn flags in protest to the death of Osama Bin Laden 
“As we see it, we have no objection to clarifying to the brothers that they may, in such conditions, masturbate, since this is an extreme case.” 
Bin Laden’s liberal views on self-gratification comes as no great surprise after the Al-Qaeda leader was found with a huge collection of porn in his Pakistani lair. GETTY The Abbottabad compound where bin Laden was killed by Navy SEALs in 2011 
The DNI released a list of the barbaric leader’s reading matter as well as a collection of letters from family members, but refused to disclose details about bin Laden’s erotica because of the “nature” of the material. 
Brian Hale, a spokesman for the DNI, told The Telegraph: “We have no plans to release that at this point in time. DNI The newly released document detailing Osama's orders to his aide Abu Muhammad Salah 
“Due to the nature of the content the decision was made not to release it.” 
The Navy SEALs who killed bin Laden in his Abbottabad compound in 2011 reportedly discovered a “fairly extensive” porn collection, containing many modern videos. Related articles
